Description: Fragment of undyed cream wool, plain weave textile with a tapestry (single warp threads) of a Greek cross; Cross in yellow outlined in black and decorated with five "jewels", half red, half green; Bars of cross finish in horn-like projections; Warp: S spun, c.14 tpc; Weft: S spun, c. 12 tpc in plain areas, c.34 in tapestry; Edges: cut or ragged
Curator's comments: Previous location cupboard 64, blue box; Use unclear, wool suggest clothing but not the motif; Edges cut after excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (19.9.1989)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: OA.758 (registered under OA number from 18.1.1973 - 19.9.1989.)
